intro: Alsinella nodosa, commonly known as the nodular alsinella, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Alsinella nodosa is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
